meanings.sent1: Our family belongs to the same denomination and attends church together every Sunday.
meanings.sent2: The denomination of Buddhism focuses on meditation and mindfulness.
meanings.sent3: I heard a joke about a denomination of penguins that only wear tuxedos to church.
meanings.sent4: In the denomination of sports fans, soccer enthusiasts are known for their passionate support.
meanings.sent5: The denomination of artists who specialize in watercolor paintings gathered for a workshop.

meanings.definition: A unit of value in a system of currency
meanings.sent1: I need to exchange my currency for a smaller denomination to make the purchase.
meanings.sent2: The vending machine only accepts coins in the denomination of quarters.
meanings.sent3: It was a strange sight to see someone pay for a car in the denomination of pennies.
meanings.sent4: She found an old coin of a rare denomination in her grandfather's collection.
meanings.sent5: The store clerk counted the bills in the denomination of fives before closing for the day.

meanings.definition: A category or class of things with shared characteristics
meanings.sent1: The bookstore has a denomination of books dedicated to mystery novels.
meanings.sent2: In the animal kingdom, the denomination of mammals includes humans, dogs, and cats.
meanings.sent3: The denomination of fruits at the market was so diverse, it was hard to choose just one.
meanings.sent4: She sorted her stamp collection into the denomination of countries they were from.
meanings.sent5: The denomination of vehicles parked outside ranged from bicycles to luxury cars.
